column2: COVID-19 negative certification required for entering the country. Foreign nationals with certificate proof of vaccination, do not need a PCR test prior to entering Kazakhstan. Other travellers need to show a coronavirus free PCR certificate issued within three days prior to arrival in Kazakhstan.
column3: Self-isolation at own accommodation- subject to PCR. Travellers entering Kazakhstan who test positive for coronavirus currently need to self-isolate for 10 days. Those needing medical assistance may be confined in state facilities.
column4: Foreign nationals with certificate proof of vaccination, do not need a PCR test prior to entering Kazakhstan.
column5:
Latest News: Authorities ease temporary COVID-19 travel restrictions (Astana Times, 09.02.2022).

International Restrictions:
*Entry to Kazakhstan: Some foreign nationals donâ€™t need a visa to enter Kazakhstan. But this could change at short notice if the COVID-19 situation changes. See the government of Kazakhstan website for further details. *Testing / screening on arrival: Foreign nationals with certificate proof of vaccination, do not need a PCR test prior to entering Kazakhstan. Other travellers need to show a coronavirus free PCR certificate issued within three days prior to arrival in Kazakhstan.
If you need further information about entry requirements, contact the local immigration authorities or the nearest Kazakh embassy. You should also check with your airline or travel company for the latest information.
*Quarantine requirements: Travellers from the UK no longer need to quarantine when arriving in Kazakhstan, if they have a negative PCR test certificate or proof of vaccination. Travellers entering Kazakhstan who test positive for coronavirus currently need to self-isolate for 10 days. Those needing medical assistance may be confined in state facilities.
*Data collection: Travellers need to provide details of where they are staying in Kazakhstan and to confirm they will abide by all coronavirus restrictions.
*Testing on departure: Travellers may be screened by having their temperature taken and assessed for other coronavirus symptoms on departure from Kazakhstan.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Kazakhstan: There are occasionally local restrictions in place, particularly in the south due to recent unrest. Breaches of regulations can result in fines or eventually imprisonment
Accommodation: Most hotels are open, although some close at short notice due to low demand.
Public places and services: Almost all Covid restrictions have been lifted, other than in medical facilities, where face coverings should continue to be worn.
*If you test positive for COVID-19, you may need to stay where you are until you test negative. You may also need to seek treatment there.
